acd-element.description: lists the steps required to generate a representative true positive event which triggers this alert.

additional_resources.description: Any other internal, external, or technical references that may be useful for understanding the ADS.

blind_spots_and_assumptions.description: Recognized issues, assumptions, and areas where an ADS may not fire.

categorization.description: Provides a mapping of the ADS to the relevant entry in the Att&CK.

categorization_others.description: Provides a mapping of the ADS to the relevant entry in the Att&CK if 'categorization is not sufficient'.

date.description: Enter date, when ADS has been created or edited.

false_positives.description: Known instances of an ADS misfiring due to a misconfiguration, idiosyncrasy in the environment, or other non-malicious scenario.

goal.description: Short, plaintext description of the type of behavior the ADS is supposed to detect.

priority.description: Describes the various alerting levels that an ADS may be tagged with.

responses.description: General response steps in the event that this alert fired.

strategy_abstract.description: High-level walkthrough of how the ADS functions.

technical_context.description: Detailed information and background needed for a responder to understand all components of the alert.

validation.description: lists the steps required to generate a representative true positive event which triggers this alert.

description: An object defining ADS - Alerting and Detection Strategy by PALANTIR. Can be used for detection engineering.
name: ADS
